definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He drew as much as two thousand francs a year from it; this constituted nearly the whole of his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他因而每年能挣两千法郎，这便是他的全部家产了。

sentences.english: May the creditor seize all his belongings and strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
sentences.chinese: 使债主搜刮他所有的家产，使外人劫掠他劳力的所赚。

sentences.english: When the crash came, the family was forced to dispose of most of its possessions.
sentences.chinese: 家庭破落时，这家人只得变卖大部分家产。

sentences.english: The only child acceded to the family estate.
sentences.chinese: 这个独生子继承了家产。

sentences.english: Don't go for wealth ; even that fades away.
sentences.chinese: 不要追求万贯家产，财富最终也会化为乌有。

sentences.english: And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.
sentences.chinese: 以斯帖派末底改管理哈曼的家产。

sentences.english: Siblings become enemies, fighting over assets that are left.
sentences.chinese: 所遗家产，成为兄弟反目，争相抢夺。

sentences.english: I'll just have to sell up now to get some ready cash.
sentences.chinese: 我必须变卖家产才能得到现金。

sentences.english: Don't go for wealth even that fades away.
sentences.chinese: 不要追求万贯家产，财富也会散尽。

sentences.english: The family flew off with all their possessions.
sentences.chinese: 这家人带着全部家产飞走了。

sentences.english: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
sentences.chinese: 他的家产必被掠去，在神忿怒的日子被冲走。

sentences.english: He only gave away a small part of his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他只散掉了小部分家产。

sentences.english: WangTingShan offered to the house of all our headquarters peng as divorce conditions.
sentences.chinese: 王庭山提出要彭皓天全部的家产作为离婚条件。

sentences.english: He was slavering after that small fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他垂涎于那份小小家产。

sentences.english: You need a housekeeper to nurse your property.
sentences.chinese: 你需要雇用一名管家来精心料理你的家产。

sentences.english: He spent all his large fortune on endowing a hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他把庞大的家产全部捐给了一家医院。

definition: to squander one's fortune/to dissipate one's wealth
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
to search a house and confiscate possessions
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
